content: Obey God and Prosper
“Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the judgments which the  your God has commanded  to teach you, so that you may do  in the land where you are going over to take possession of it,
so that you, your son, and your grandson will fear the  your God, to keep all His statutes and His commandments which I command you, all the days of your life, and that your days may be prolonged.

Now Israel, you shall listen and be careful to do , so that it may go well for you and that you may increase greatly, just as the , the God of your fathers, has promised you,  a land flowing with milk and honey.
“Hear, Israel! The  is our God, the  is one!
And you shall love the  your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength.
These words, which I am commanding you today, shall be on your heart.
And you shall repeat them diligently to your sons and speak of them when you sit in your house, when you walk on the road, when you lie down, and when you get up.
You shall also tie them as a sign to your hand, and they shall be as frontlets on your forehead.
You shall also write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
“Then it shall come about when the  your God brings you into the land that He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give you, great and splendid cities which you did not build,
and houses full of all good things which you did not fill, and carved cisterns which you did not carve out, vineyards and olive trees which you did not plant, and you eat and are satisfied,
be careful that you do not forget the  who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
You shall fear  the  your God; and you shall worship Him and swear by His name.
You shall not follow other gods, any of the gods of the peoples who surround you,
for the  your God  in the midst of you is a jealous God; , or else the anger of the  your God will be kindled against you, and He will wipe you off the face of the earth.
“You shall not put the  your God to the test, as you tested  at Massah.
You shall diligently keep the commandments of the  your God, and His provisions and His statutes which He has commanded you.
You shall do what is right and good in the sight of the , so that it may go well for you and that you may go in and take possession of the good land which the  swore to  your fathers,
